Text:
Are you certain you want us to infiltrate this
hideout again, Lady Alpha?
Yesâ€”to create smoke where there is no fire.
Again? Was there someone we missed the first time?

Impossible. I'm certain we took everyone out. We even
cured and rescued the possessed.
Of course we did. It's only natural to kill 'em all.
Try and refrain from killing this time, Delta.
Why?! You scared, Lady Alpha?!
...Excuse me?!
Eeek?!

When have I ever been afraid of our enemies?
My memory is hazy, so I'd be grateful if you
could enlighten me.
U-Um...
Hmm? Delta.

Y-You know what...forget it. It's all just a big
misunderstanding!
Oh, is that so?

You don't learn, do you? Lady Alpha is saying that we
can't get intel out of them if you kill them all first.

...Well then, we shift this lamp post here to the
right like this...and pull it down.
Whoa! An underground path just appeared!
This is the hidden entrance, Lady Alpha.

This hideout has lost all its meaning as a base. We
took out all the Cult members, and the mysterious
paladin lost his life.

If the enemy were to discover such a place was still
active...I wonder how they'd act.
You mean we can't be sure they'll retaliate?

If there's a chance the enemy may make some kind of
move, we must take advantage of it!
We're gonna set a trap! Real clever, Lady Alpha!

Lady Alpha, who are you referring to when you say
"enemy"?

Members of the Cult, of course, and the organization
of the mysterious paladin that Beta encountered.

That organization...is most likely related to the
Church, but we'll see if they have any connection to
the Cult.

Regardless of the relationship between the two, can
they afford to ignore us when we make a move on their
hideout?
Whoa...!
Lady Alpha's beauty is truly terrifying...

What are you two doing? It's time to infiltrate the
hideout. Follow after me quietly.
Got it!
Understood!

Ideally, we should acquire some intel in the next few
days. If nothing occurs after holding out for a week,
we'll withdraw for the time being.

Hee-hee! I'm gonna grill meat every day starting
today! I've brought plenty of boar meat!

It's a good thing this hideout is equipped with all
the facilities for daily life.

This place takes advantage of the water supply
running beneath the Sacred Land of Lindwurm,
making it possible to remain here long-term.

If the Cult could secure this massive space, we'll
have to assume they already held influence in this
land long before the city had fully taken shape.

You mean they've been using this place as their
territory for ages? Damn, those Cult bastards
play dirty!

Delta's right. Lurking in the shadows is no excuse to
take advantage of others' labor.

In comparison, the Garden is self-sufficient. Even
when it comes to raising capital for our war chest,
while we may use disguises, we are the ones who
do the work!

I would never fight in a way that would sully
Shadow's battle aestheticsâ€”not now...or ever.

Looks like they've been lured here by the stench and
the remorse of the dead!

Not a big fan of fighting ghosts since you don't get
to feel your fangs tearing their flesh apart.

There's also no way to make a feast out of them.
Boring... I wanna fight living things instead!

Well, we'll have to clean up these ghosts first
before causing mayhem in this hideout.
